results.title: I own the racecourse
results.creator_credit: Bush Christmas Productions, John Edwards, Timothy Read and Stephen Ramsey
results.brief_description: A heartwarming and humorous story from the novel by Patricia Wrightson. Set in Sydney, a backward child named Andy buys a racecourse for Three Dollars from a tramp.

results.title: I owe you
results.brief_description: Designed to encourage managers to consider their influence on the development of subordinate managers and supervisors. Highlights the dissatisfaction and frustrations aroused in subordinates when a manager overlooks their natural desire for development in their jobs. Describes the main points of an action plan devised to solve a work problem and improve subordinate skills.

results.title: I never loved you
results.creator_credit: Cassandra Tytler, Monkey Suit Productions, Corinne Preston and Rebecca McPherson
results.brief_description: Broken hearts, longing and regret…..”I Never loved you” does a tango and a twirl around the question of love. It exalts in the high passion and tragedy of love and romance, all the while too aware that love can be finite and fleeting. Tough guys singing tender songs to gals with innocent hearts but eyes that have seen too much; doe-eyed lovers are left with bloodshot eyes, nursing regret and a broken heart; the carousel of love moves on, passion can make you giddy and then throw you off balance. Where did it all go wrong? Cast includes: Alex Ben Mayor, Louise Woodward, Connal Parsley, Charlie Sheldon.

results.title: I need more staff
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: A management game which highlights pressures at the middle management level including competing staff claims and personality relationships. The film is intended to assist group analysis and discussion of management problems relating or organisational control and co-ordination, and for use in the training of middle and senior management groups. Cast includes Don Philps, Stanley Walsh, Bruce Myles, Ronald Morse, John Orcsik.

results.title: I name this ship
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Don Murray
results.brief_description: The “Empress of Australia” built at Cockatoo Island Dockyard in Sydney Harbour, is the newest and the largest passenger vessel in the Australian Coastal Shipping Commission. On paper it represented a unique challenge to the Australian ship building industry. Designed to carry passengers and motor vehicles as well as freight between Sydney and Tasmania. Provides luxurious passenger accommodation, services and recreational facilties for the 40 hour trip.

results.title: I like maths
results.creator_credit: Neville Stanley, Jeff Spencer and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
Introduces three teachers from Corio West Primary School who have developed a series of mathematical “games” to make mathematics more relevant to real-life situations.

results.title: I Know they can get me pregnant (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Would-be mothers, patients at the In-Vitro Fertilisation Clinic at the Royal North Shore Hospital, describe their feelings. This program provides material for discussion on such topics as the role of the social worker, the ethics of test-tube babies and the care of patients.

results.title: I know an old lady who swallowed a fly
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Colin Low, Tom Daly and Derek Lamb
results.brief_description: A nonsense song, sung by Burl Ives and given unrestrained interpretation by the cartoonist. Of course, by the time the song ends the old lady has swallowed much more than a fly. Written by Canadian folksinger Alan Mills. (Awards: Santa Barbara; Chicago; Gottwaldov)

results.title: I Know a secret (K)
results.creator_credit: Atlantis Films, Michael Macmillan, Seaton McLean, Janice Platt and Bruce Pittman
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of a short story by Lucy Maud Montgomery set during the late 1930s. The story is about a young girl called Jane Lawrence, and some children she becomes acquainted with after she moves to the country with her mother to live.
